page.title: 20Travel in Morchard Bishop
page.content: Although the village lies on the route of the old turnpike road from Exeter to Barnstaple,it is now 2.5 miles from the new main road,built in the valley in the 19th century.Milestones are still in place along the road.The only public transport now is that run by a local coach company.This is a weekly bus to Crediton and 1 to Exeter.'Devon General',having closed their twice daily service several years ago. Local coaches also take children to schools in Chulmleigh and Crediton,starting collection at 7.30a.m..Almost everyone has a car or van as many houses and farms are scattered,some down narrow lanes.Few use bicycles as it so hilly and the elderly find walking more difficult,so often rely on lifts from friends.The nearly rail station is 2.5 miles away and is little used.
